sub_title: Co-Owner and Developer of Virtual Ambiance
summary:
I have over 20 years of experience working in various roles, including software development, web editing, helpdesk support, training and coaching, tutoring, and scientific research.

My passion lies in improving work processes, especially in the non-profit sectors of education and healthcare, through the implementation of data processing systems. I am a skilled team player who excels at motivating my colleagues and possesses a creative problem-solving mindset.

In my free time, I enjoy playing piano and have a passion for improvisation. In recent years, I have successfully balanced my own business with being a devoted father to three children.

My aspiration is to become a professional system designer and software developer, with the ultimate goal of becoming a leading consultant in my field.

I am currently expanding my software knowledge through programming in Java and Python, using Object-Oriented Programming techniques, as well as deepening my understanding of Scrum project management methodology.  My primary interests lie in Machine Learning and Data Science, and I am excited to continue learning and developing my skills in these areas.

courses.name: Object Oriented Programming OOP and Design Patterns

profile_positions.description:
Virtual Ambiance specializes in producing audio and video content to enhance various settings, including relaxation, background ambience, sleep aid, audio and video stock footage, and backdrops.

Our team is proficient in filming and recording high-quality digital media, and we take charge of the majority of the editing and publishing processes ourselves (mainly using Audacity, DaVinci Resolve and FFmpeg). At Virtual Ambiance, we manage two websites, virtualambiance.com and virtual-fireplace.net, and showcase our diverse range of content on two popular YouTube channels, Virtual Ambiance and Virtual Fireplace.

In addition, I have extensive experience with automation in this role. For example, I developed a shell script that utilize FFmpeg software to stream video and audio separately to YouTube on a Raspberry Pi. I also created several small shell scripts to automate the process of merging video fragments and audio, as well as applying various sound effects.

Related to this, I have further expanded my knowledge of Java, Python, and Object-Oriented Programming using Design Patterns. I took this step because I am determined to further develop myself in this field.
profile_positions.title: Co-Owner and Developer

profile_positions.description:
● Developing digital marketing strategies
● Video editing expertise
● Website development proficiency
profile_positions.title: Digital Marketing Manager

profile_positions.description:
I have experience in writing news articles and informative content in the fields of healthcare and education. I have interviewed healthcare professionals and published content through a CMS (Ruby on Rails with Apache). In addition, I have automated and streamlined business processes using Visual Basic for Applications (VBA). Specifically, I have worked on the following projects:

Searching and filtering relevant news articles to improve the publication process, using the Document Object Model (DOM) for HTML and XML documents. I developed, tested, and implemented this system for my colleagues as well.
- Conducting research on the dangers and vulnerabilities of web scraping.
- Collecting and analysing Twitter data.
- Writing code in VBA to automatically search for copyright-free photos.
- Searching for relevant contacts on Hyves, filtering them, and automatically saving new contacts in Excel.
- Identifying and reporting invalid links on the website.

Overall, my skills in writing and automating business processes have helped to improve efficiency and productivity in my previous workplace.
profile_positions.title: Web Editor

profile_positions.description:
During my studies in Biology Education at the University of Groningen, I gained experience in providing Biology lessons to upper-level classes of HAVO and VWO students. As part of my training to become a first-grade Biology teacher, I aimed to instill a deep understanding of the subject matter in my students, while also nurturing their critical thinking and scientific inquiry skills. 

Although my path led me to pursue a different career, my time as a Biology teacher-in-training ignited a passion for the subject that I've studied. Through my experience working with adolescent students and exploring various teaching methods, I gained valuable insights into the complexities of effective teaching and learning.
profile_positions.title: Biology Teacher

profile_positions.description:
As an environmental historical research assistant, I previously worked on the "Vervolg Landsdekkend Beeld" (Continuation of National Soil Quality Monitoring Program) project for the Municipality of Groningen. My main responsibility was to investigate sites suspected of severe soil contamination based on historical information.

During my time in this role, I collected missing location data using various resources such as the Historical Soil Database (HBB), the Geographic National Government Soil Information System (GLOBIS), the archives of the Groningen Environmental Services, and site visits. I also processed research results in the BODIN soil information system, developed drilling plans, generated location reports, and designed and built an Excel system for verifying research results.
profile_positions.title: Milieuhistorisch onderzoeker

profile_positions.description:
As a former employee at the University Medical Center Groningen (UMCG), I was responsible for integrating patient videos and digital images with the 'Elektronisch patiëntendossier (EPD)" (electronic health record (EHR) system.

This involved linking video recordings of patients during diagnostic intake with their corresponding patient data in the EHR system, as well as designing and building a control system in Excel. Additionally, I was responsible for digitizing image material and integrating it with the UMCG's EPR system (ZIS/Poliplus).
profile_positions.title: Databasemedewerker Neurologie

profile_positions.description:
- Answering inquiries from Nuon (the former Vattenfall Nederland) customers and providing advice.
- Consulting and updating the CRM system (Siebel and SAP).
profile_positions.title: 1st line support helpdesk employee

profile_positions.description:
Conducting fMRI (functional magnetic resonance imaging) research on specific brain activity when receiving a monetary reward for task performance in different groups of people (control subjects, smokers, and Parkinson's patients).

Responsibilities include:
- Designing and conducting experiments (fMRI, psychometry).
- Acquiring and analyzing data using SPSS and SPM2 (MATLAB-based).
- Writing and modifying UNIX Shell scripts, including converting DICOM files from the Mosaic web browser to SPM software.
- Using other UNIX techniques such as remote work (as a user) through SSH Secure Shell Client, scp (Secure Copy), Emacs.
- MATLAB scripting:
	- Generating txt files based on specific user input.
	- Analyzing output txt files and generating new files.
- Supervising psychology (master thesis) and medical students (scientific internship/tutor groups).
profile_positions.title: Scientific researcher in Neurology/Biological Psychiatry

profile_positions.description:
Tasks include:
- Studying and inventorying soil investigation reports and environmental archives of potentially soil-threatening locations in various municipalities (Hengelo, Staphorst, Wijhe-Olst and Rijssen).
- Translating outdated address and location data into current information.
profile_positions.title: Employee Environmental Law Inventory (Hinderwetinventarisatie) and Soil Investigation
